intro: Oxylobium ovalifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oxylobium, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. Its botanical characteristics include woody stems and a compact growth habit. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats.
